article.title: Galaxy on Kubernetes
article.content:
In order to facilitate the deployment of Galaxy on kubernetes (K8s), we have developed a Helm chart that can be executed on a K8s cluster to deploy an instance of Galaxy.

In general, the following steps are required to deploy Galaxy on a K8s cluster using the Helm charts:

  1. Create a K8s cluster;
  2. Install/configure Helm;
  3. Deploy Galaxy using the Helm chart;
  4. Access and manage the Galaxy instance;
  5. Delete cluster.

Since a K8s cluster setup and configuration differs between platforms, we recommend that users consult the desired platform's documentation on the specifics of creating and managing a K8s cluster. However, as an example, here we describe how to deploy Galaxy on the following managed K8s services:

  • Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS)
  • Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE)
